Key Arguments: The submission raises concerns about DNA contamination in Pfizer and Moderna COVID-19 vaccines, suggesting that the contamination levels are significantly above regulatory limits.
It criticizes the peer-review system as being influenced by vested interests in the pharmaceutical industry.
The authors argue that the vaccines should have been classified as genetically modified organisms (GMOs) and required appropriate licensing, which they claim is missing.
The submission questions the actions of regulatory authorities, suggesting they have failed to address the contamination issue adequately.
It raises alarm about potential health risks associated with the contamination, including oncogenic and prothrombotic effects.
Main Themes: Criticism of Peer-Review and Scientific Integrity
Potential Health Risks of DNA Contamination
Notable Quotes: Freedom of speech is paramount to the truth.
The market will validate this finding long before traditional peer review even puts its boots on.
Every single person who has been injected with these products has received a GMO that has not been through the expert regulatory process in this country.
